content.description: Scientific evidence has revealed five mass extinctions in the history of life on Earth.
content.question: Table 1. Five Mass Extinctions Time period (million years ago) Percent of species lost Probable cause <math alttext="65 million years ago" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mya</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 75% Asteroid impact and volcanism <math alttext="200 million years ago" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mya</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 75% Asteroid impact and volcanism <math alttext="250 million years ago" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mya</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 95% Cold climate, formation of Pangea, Siberian volcanism <math alttext="355 million years ago" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>355</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mya</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 70-80% Global cooling <math alttext="435 million years ago" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>435</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mya</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 22% Global cooling Some scientists propose that due to human activity and climate change, a sixth mass extinction has already begun. Select the best alternate hypothesis to support this claim.

choices.label: Current temperature changes will correlate with temperature changes during previous extinctions.
Observed modern extinction rates will resemble the rates found early in previous extinctions.
The number of species present on Earth will equal the number of species on Earth before the last extinction.
The number of species present on Earth will equal the number of species on Earth after the last extinction.

content.answer: Observed modern extinction rates will resemble the rates found early in previous extinctions.

skill.text: 3.B: State the null hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
